answer: Power BI is a business analytics tool by Microsoft used to visualize data and share insights through dashboards and reports.
Main components: Power BI Desktop, Power BI Service, Power BI Mobile, Power Query, Power Pivot, and Power BI Gateway.
DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) is a formula language used in Power BI for calculations and measures.
Calculated column is computed row-by-row and stored in table. Measure is calculated dynamically based on filter context.
Power Query is used for data cleaning, transformation, and ETL before loading data into Power BI.
Relationship connects tables using keys like primary key and foreign key to enable filtering across tables.
Dashboard is a single-page view of visuals created in Power BI Service to monitor KPIs.
Import mode loads data into Power BI memory. DirectQuery connects live to database without storing data.
Filter context is the set of filters applied to data when calculating measures in Power BI.
Star schema has one fact table and multiple dimension tables. It improves performance and simplifies relationships in Power BI.
A slicer is a visual filter that allows users to filter data interactively.
A visual is a graphical representation of data such as charts, tables, and maps.
Power BI Service is a cloud platform to publish, share, and manage reports and dashboards.
Power BI Desktop is a Windows application used to create reports and data models.
A data model defines relationships between tables to enable analysis.
Cardinality defines relationship type such as one-to-many or many-to-many.
Cross filter direction determines how filters flow between related tables.
Row Level Security restricts data access for specific users.
A calculated table is created using DAX and stored in the model.
Drill-through allows users to navigate to detailed reports filtered by selected data.
KPI visual shows performance against a target value.
Conditional formatting changes visual appearance based on values.
Bookmark saves the current report view including filters and visuals.
Incremental refresh updates only new or changed data instead of full dataset.
Context transition converts row context into filter context in DAX calculations.
CALCULATE modifies filter context to evaluate an expression.
ALL removes filters from specified columns; ALLEXCEPT keeps filters on specified columns.
Time intelligence functions calculate YTD, MTD, QTD, and previous period values.
Composite model combines Import and DirectQuery sources in one report.
Aggregation improves performance by summarizing data at higher levels.
Gateway connects on-premises data sources to Power BI Service.
Data refresh updates dataset with latest data from source.
Hierarchy organizes data levels like Year > Quarter > Month.
Many-to-many relationship allows multiple matches between tables.
Optimize by reducing columns, using star schema, limiting visuals, and optimizing DAX.
VertiPaq is the in-memory engine that compresses and processes data efficiently.
SUM adds column values; SUMX iterates row by row and evaluates an expression.
Report level filters apply to whole report, page level to one page, visual level to specific visual.
Data profiling analyzes column distribution, quality, and statistics in Power Query.
M language is used in Power Query for data transformation.
Role playing dimension uses same dimension table multiple times for different relationships.
Bidirectional filtering may cause ambiguity and performance issues.
Custom visuals are user-created visuals imported from marketplace.
Workspace is a collaborative space to manage reports and datasets.
Import stores data in memory, DirectQuery queries source live, Live connection connects to existing dataset.
Dataflow is cloud-based ETL process in Power BI Service.
Drill-down allows navigating through hierarchy levels in a visual.
Performance Analyzer identifies slow visuals and DAX queries.
DAX Studio is an external tool used to analyze and optimize DAX queries.
Best practices include simple layout, proper KPIs, consistent colors, and minimal clutter.
Total Sales = SUM(Sales[Amount])
Profit = SUM(Sales[Amount]) - SUM(Sales[Cost])
Profit % = DIVIDE([Profit], [Total Sales])
Sales YTD = TOTALYTD([Total Sales], 'Date'[Date])
Previous Month Sales = CALCULATE([Total Sales], PREVIOUSMONTH('Date'[Date]))
MoM % = DIVIDE([Total Sales] - [Previous Month Sales], [Previous Month Sales])
Running Total = CALCULATE([Total Sales], FILTER(ALL('Date'), 'Date'[Date] <= MAX('Date'[Date])))
Total All Sales = CALCULATE([Total Sales], ALL(Sales))
Customer Count = DISTINCTCOUNT(Sales[CustomerID])
Top 5 Sales = CALCULATE([Total Sales], TOPN(5, ALL(Products), [Total Sales]))
Rank Product = RANKX(ALL(Products), [Total Sales], , DESC)
Avg Sales per Customer = DIVIDE([Total Sales], DISTINCTCOUNT(Sales[CustomerID]))
Last Year Sales = CALCULATE([Total Sales], SAMEPERIODLASTYEAR('Date'[Date]))
YoY % = DIVIDE([Total Sales] - [Last Year Sales], [Last Year Sales])
Row Count = COUNTROWS(Sales)
High Sales = IF([Total Sales] > 100000, "High", "Low")
Sales 2024 = CALCULATE([Total Sales], 'Date'[Year] = 2024)
Selected Year Sales = CALCULATE([Total Sales], VALUES('Date'[Year]))
% of Total = DIVIDE([Total Sales], CALCULATE([Total Sales], ALL(Sales)))
Title = "Sales Report - " & SELECTEDVALUE('Date'[Year])
